label: Sports
sentence:
Title: whats the best way to do boxing at home, on my own?
Question: i love boxing and want to get fit doing it at home, but how?
Answer: To be perfectly honest with you, the best way to do boxing at home, is to not do boxing at home. There's all kinds of reasons for this, but I will give you only a couple. I'm writing to you about this with over 33 years of experience and many failed attempts of "Boxing at home"

   There's the little mistakes that you pick up while you're training at home, dropping your hand as you throw your jab, not shooting your jab straight out, not pivoting on your foot properly when throwing the left hook, stepping straight back with your head up in the air, cat-pawing when you start to get tired. These are the most common of mistakes that everyone starting out training at home does, maybe not all of them but definitely some of them.

  Then there's the fact that you're not around the gym atmosphere
the smell of a boxing gym. The subconscious telling you to push yourself harder than the guy hitting the bag next to you. The fact that your being watched by guys/girls who know what they're doing and you want to show that you belong. The fact that the noises that come from a gym give you a rush unlike anything you've ever experienced.

   The money you spend on a "Home Gym" will be a complete waste, how many times have you bought something you had to have and six months later you thought what a waste? Spend your money on a Gym membership or Gym dues, stay away from Health Clubs like Ballys, Golds Gym, World Gym and countless others who know absolutely nothing about boxing except Rocky's coming out on Christmas.

  I understand your position completely, to just stay in shape get yourself a freestanding bag, it's a great way to stay in shape. It's next to impossible to get into the shape you have to be in to actually compete at home, for all the above mentioned reasons and then some.

  Good luck.

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Question: why is time measured in multiple of 12??? it could have been 10 ???
Answer: Actually time is measured in multiples of 24.  It may have something to do with our angular measurement system.  The Earth rotates 360° every 24 hours.  Each hour represents 15° of angular rotation.  Each minute of time represents 15 minutes of angular rotation and each second of time represents 15 seconds of angular rotation.  As to where our time measurement system came from, I don't know, but it could probably be found out pretty easily by doing a few searches.

Check this link for books on the subject:
http://books.google.com/books?q=origin+of+time+measurement&ots=V7_ssegXJ4&sa=X&oi=print&ct=title

label: Computers & Internet
sentence:
Question: What is the full form of ALOHA protocol ?
Answer: ALOHA PROTOCOL:

Aloha, also called the Aloha method, refers to a simple communications scheme in which each source (transmitter) in a network sends data whenever there is a frame to send.  If the frame successfully reaches the destination (receiver), the next frame is sent.  If the frame fails to be received at the destination, it is sent again.  This protocol was originally developed at the University of Hawaii for use with satellite communication systems in the Pacific.

In a wireless broadcast system or a half-duplex two-way link, Aloha works perfectly.  But as networks become more complex, for example in an Ethernet system involving multiple sources and destinations in which data travels many paths at once, trouble occurs because data frames collide (conflict).  The heavier the communications volume, the worse the collision problems become.  The result is degradation of system efficiency, because when two frames collide, the data contained in both frames is lost.

To minimize the number of collisions, thereby optimizing network efficiency and increasing the number of subscribers that can use a given network, a scheme called slotted Aloha was developed.  This system employs signals called beacons that are sent at precise intervals and tell each source when the channel is clear to send a frame.  Further improvement can be realized by a more sophisticated protocol called Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Detection (CSMA).

In 1070s, Norman Abram son and his colleagues at the University of Hawaii devised a new and elegant method to solve the channel allocation problem. Many researchers have extended their work since then. Although Abranson's work, called the Aloha System, used ground-based radio broadcasting, the basic idea is applicable to any system in which uncoordinated users are completing for the use of a single shared channel.

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Question: can anybody teach me how to calculate allele frequency...?
Answer: Assuming your species is diploid, it goes like this:

Supposing there is a field of red, pink and white flowers. Red flowers have genotype RR, pink Rr or rR, and white rr. 

You count the number of each kind of flower. It turns out there are 150 red-flowered plants, 480 pink, and 170 white ones. 

Therefore there are 2*(150+480+170) = 1600 alleles out there. There are 300 Rs in the red plants, 480 in the pink ones and 0 in the white. Added together there are 780. 780/1600 = 0.4875, so the frequency of the R allele is 48.75%

As for the r allele, there are 0 in the red-flowered plants, 480 in the pink, and 340 in the white. Added together, there are 820. 820/1600 is 51.25%.

As a double check, 48.75% + 51.25% = 100%

label: Health
sentence:
Title: Can i get Mercury poisoning from eating to much tuna even if i am not pregnant ?
Question: i will eat a tuna sandwich in the morning and sometimes i feal like it for lunch.I once had tuna for dinner the night before and breakfast and lunch the following day so my pregnant friend told me i should not do it because i will get murcury poisining.
Answer: The mercury-in-fish dietary guidelines issued by the Food and Drug Administration are only for pregnant women, women who are planning to become pregnant, and young children. And even then, the FDA's guidelines are overly cautious. The FDA has issued no consumption advice about the amount of fish that's safe for older kids, teens, men, post-menopausal women, and women who don't plan to become pregnant.
In the FDA's own words, its mercury guideline "was established to limit consumers' methyl mercury exposure to levels 10 times lower than the lowest levels associated with adverse effects." So even if a pregnant woman consumed twice as much mercury as the FDA's recommended limit, she would still be protected by a 500-percent cushion.
So determine which category you are and eat accordingly. 
There is tuna consumption calculator but rough estimate is that it is safe to eat 2 ounces for 3 ponds of you weigh.
example you weight 120 lbs 
multiply it by 2 and divided by 3 = 80 ounces of tuna per week almost 2 lbs.

label: Computers & Internet
sentence:
Title: How do I make this page bigger?
Question: I just got a new computer today and when I am on this Answers page, the top part all overlaps. (i can only see part of the section that says "My Q&A" because it overlaps with "Hello Kendra" etc..) Can I make this page bigger? Is my font to big? Hellllllp!?!
Answer: (1) First of all, if it's a brand new computer, and it didn't go through a ton of updates when you first connected it to the internet, go to http://www.windowsupdate.com/ and make sure you've got the latest and greatest from our GREAT friends at Microsoft.  For your issue, this is only pertinent if you're using Internet Explorer, but it's always a good thing to do.

(2) Make sure your screen resolution (right click on the desktop, properties, settings) is set to at least 800x600, preferably 1024x768.

(3) Make sure the browser window is maximized.

(4) Make sure you have IE, or preferably Firefox, from http://www.mozilla.com/

(5) Make sure your text size is good.  With the two browsers mentioned above, click and hold the control key while you scroll the mouse wheel (if you have one) slowly up and down til you get what you want.

(6) If you have some sort of ad-blocking software, turn it off and restart your browser.  If something here is mistaken for an ad, it can cause a problem like that.

Hope that helps!!!

Question: Assignment=Villanelle, relies on rhyme and repetion


Silent Soil From Silent Days


His song is being written by his ways;
for each, but once, may don life’s wings and fly.
One man controls the volume of his days.

A breast so warm, a collar blue, may raise
him to his feet—but soon will wave thereby,
his song is being written by his ways.

His peers and he conquer the world, a phase
where sight becomes so bright, it blinds the eye.
This man controls the volume of his days.

The vice of life so twists as youth betrays—
his well of youth, so opportune, near dry.
His song is being written by his ways.

With desperate fire, his gray will sets to blaze:
too weak, too late, too dry to catch the eye,
this man controlled the volume of his days.

And now, in silent soil from silent days,
cry fools that thought no scythe would make them lie.
Each song is being written by his ways,
One man controls the volume of his days.

Question: Hi, I'm a student studying Early Childhood Education.
I still don't understand "stages of symbolic play".
Could you please tell me what it is?
Answer: check out that link. i see "stages of play" and "symbollic play" is one of them, is that what you need?

Symbolic Play:
Symbolic play is when children begin to substitute one object for another. For a 3- or 4-year-old toddler, a pillowcase becomes a superhero cape and the cardboard core of a roll of paper towels is used as a trumpet.
By age 4 or 5, a child's ideas and experiences with family and the social world provide material for games like 'house' or 'driving the car.' While some play is solitary or shared with adults, most symbolic play takes place with school peers or neighborhood buddies. Kids this age also adore construction play, building (with toys like Lego or blocks), and rough and tumble play (like ring-around-the-rosy).

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Title: What is the basic life cycle of a coelacanth?
Question: Hehe... maybe I should also ask WHAT a coelacanth is, first... I just need to know the basics, like... what does it eat, where is it found, etc.

yannow... the basics
Answer: Coelacanths are lobe-finned fish with the pectoral and anal fins on fleshy stalks supported by bones, and the tail fin divided into three lobes, the middle one of which also includes a continuation of the notochord. Coelacanths have modified cosmoid scales, which are thinner than true cosmoid scales, which can only be found on extinct fish. Coelacanths also have a special electroreceptive device called a rosteral organ in the front of the skull, which probably helps in prey detection.

Coelacanths first appear in the fossil record in the Middle Devonian, about 390 million years ago. Prehistoric species of coelacanth lived in many bodies of water in Late Paleozoic and Mesozoic times.

The average weight of the coelacanth is 176 pounds (80 kg) and they can reach up to 6.5 feet (2 m) in length. Scientists believe individual coelacanths may live as long as 60 years.

They are the only living species known to have a functional intracranial joint, which almost completely separates the front and back halves of the skull internally. Flexure at this joint may aid in the consumption of large prey. Coelacanths are also mucilaginous; their scales release mucus and their bodies continually exude oil. This oil is a laxative, and makes the fish almost inedible unless dried and salted. Their scales are very rough, and are used by the villagers of the Comoros as sandpaper.

Coelacanth eyes are very sensitive, and have a tapetum lucidum. Coelacanths are almost never caught in the daytime or on nights with full moons, due to the sensitivity of their eyes.

Coelacanths are opportunistic feeders, hunting cuttlefish, squid, snipe eels, small sharks, and other fish found in their deep reef and volcanic slope habitats. Coelacanths are also known to swim head down, backwards and belly up to locate their prey presumably utilizing its rosteral gland. Scientists suspect that one reason this fish has been so successful is that they can slow down their metabolisms at any time, sinking into the less-inhabited depths and minimizing their nutritional requirements in a sort of hibernation mode.

Answer: Some states do all their enforcement adminstratively....so it depends on your state. label: Education & Reference
sentence:
Question: what is ohm's law?
Answer: Ohm's Law deals with the relationship between voltage and current in an ideal conductor. This relationship states that: 

The potential difference (voltage) across an ideal conductor is proportional to the current through it. 

The constant of proportionality is called the "resistance" - R. 

Ohm's Law is given by: 

V = I R

where V is the potential difference between two points which include a resistance R. 
I is the current flowing through the resistance. 

For biological work, it is often preferable to use the conductance, g = 1/R; In this form Ohm's Law is: 

I = g V

Material that obeys Ohm's Law is called "ohmic" or "linear"  because the potential difference across it varies linearly with the current.

label: Health
sentence:
Question: What is the life expectancy for a person with onset of alzheimers at age 60?
Answer: That's really a hard one to answer, because there really are no answers. It really all depends on the person, and how rapidly they decline. My father-in-law had Alzheimer's and was diagnosed in his mid 70's, but he was showing signs on the disease for 2 to 3 years prior to.  He went from beginning stage to mid stage in about 4 to 5 years, but his doctors (neurologist and family), stated that it could take up to 10 years to get to end stage, depending on his progression rate. The best thing to do is to see a neurologist and get an MRI done, and they can evaluate the brain deterioration, and give you a clearer picture as to the progression.

Question: atmospheric condition in relation to instrument performance?
Answer: Not exactly sure what you mean here. I'll assume that since it's in the astronomy section the instrument you refer to is a telescope. If the atmosphere is very turbulent you are going to get poor performance, ie it's going to be hard to focus on anything and the image is going to jump around in your field of view a bit. This can be caused be heat that is rising at night after a warm day. \nIf you are observing planets then a mild haze might not be that bad. However if it is hazy or foggy and you are trying to observe other things then this will be a problem, especially if the moon is up because the haze will defract the moonlight over a large part of the sky.

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Title: Help: Find the constant of variatin for a direct variation that includes the given values.?
Question: Help: Find the constant of variation for a direct variation that includes the given values.
(2,4)

Note: This is not my homework, im studying for the semester exams and stumble across this material which im having difficulty on. Plz help by showing the work.
Answer: Since it is a direct variation we can use the formula

y = k x

Since we are given the ordered pair (2,4) we know y=4 when x=2. Plugging these values into the formula gives us

4 = k(2)

To solve for k we divide both sides by 2 which gives us

k = 2.

It would also be correct to set up the variation to be

x = k y

In this case, we do the same procedures to find k. Plug in the known values for x and y to get that k = 1/2. Unless you are told which one to solve for either are correct. If you are given a multiple choice test I would think that only one could be a possible answer, unless you are first given the variation equation.

Title: What is wrong with me?
Question: I have a perfect smile, but lately my gums bleed when I brush my teeth. And it has become really hard to get my teeth clean. Why is this?

Once you begin treatment, you will need to continue to see your dentist regularly in order to reverse gum disease. Also, incorporate an anti-gingivitis mouth wash, if you haven't already.

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Title: What is Zero?
Question: In a previous question, I asked what 0/0 is.
This question, apparently asked several time before, brought out many opinions or moderately and highly educated people, and I thank everyone for answering!!!

But now, let's wipe all that aside.  This is a brand new question.

I want to explore the nature of the number 0.

I would like to know what benefits and consequences would occur if we treated 0 as a non-reducible number equal to 1 divided by infinity and gave is a clever symbol, like z, much the same way we treat i equal to the square root of negative 1.

I beleive doing this could solve quite a few conundrums, including 0/0.

I beleive the key is redefining how we think of the number 0 and admitting that there is no such thing 0.

Comments?
Answer: 0 in modern algebra is the additive identity. Given a function + that assigns a number to a pair of numbers, 0 is the unique number such that +(0, a) = +(a, 0) = a for every number in the set. Without 0, most of the richness of modern mathematics and proofs would be buried in cases or would be quite impossible (There are many rings, groups, fields, vector spaces, monoids, and a menagerie of other algebraic structures around us). All these structures have some sort of identity element that provides an amazing amount of additional implied structure just by existing (An example you may be familiar with is calculus; it reduces nonlinear forms to linear vector fields at each point. The existence of the 0 linear map, studied in linear algebra, lends a plethora of structure to calculus, allowing us to find extrema, curvature, invariants, etc.). As linear algebra is also used extensively in the study of differential geometry/equations, modern physics is built around the properties of 0. It is the keystone in so many proofs that without it, they would either be irreducibly ugly or would not be true at all.

As to your definition of 1/infty being 0, many number systems that include infty also have 1/infty = 0. Such systems include the affinely extended real numbers and the compactification of the complex plane. These structures are very useful in complex analysis/topology. Neither of them are fields. See the sources for details.
